title: Chintz (Thailand), 1900–1950
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: resist-dyed, mordant painted, and painted on plain weave
dimensions: H x W (loomed width): 297 x 110 cm (116 7/8 in. x 43 1/4 in.)
description: Remains of a long rectangular panel: field replaced with ivory cotton end borders reduced to three sections. each band at each end is decorated by pendant forms--two with a red ground, center with a yellow-ochre ground. Continuous border on each side framing field and bordders patterned by two alternating medallions--floral guard stripes on each side.

tombstone.epitaph:
Chintz (Thailand), 1900–1950. Medium: cotton
Technique: resist-dyed, mordant painted, and painted on plain weave. 
1972-6-7.
